question: It is true that air pollution occurs when harmful substances are released into the air, making it unsafe for living beings.
It is false that only man-made activities contribute to air pollution.
It is true that volcanic eruptions release sulfur dioxide and ash into the air, polluting it.
It is false that burning fossil fuels reduces air pollution.
It is true that carbon dioxide (CO₂) is a greenhouse gas that contributes to global warming.
It is false that air pollution has no impact on human health.
It is true that smog is formed due to vehicle emissions and industrial pollutants.
It is false that deforestation has no impact on air pollution.
It is true that acid rain is caused by pollutants like sulfur dioxide (SO₂) and nitrogen oxides (NOx).
It is false that air pollution only affects humans and not wildlife.
It is true that air pollution can lead to respiratory diseases such as asthma and bronchitis.
It is false that planting trees has no effect on reducing air pollution.
It is true that industries release harmful gases like carbon monoxide and sulfur dioxide into the air.
It is false that acid rain improves soil fertility.
It is true that ozone layer depletion increases the risk of skin cancer and UV radiation exposure.
It is false that electric vehicles contribute more pollution than petrol and diesel vehicles.
It is true that governments enforce air quality laws to reduce emissions from industries and vehicles.
It is false that household activities like burning charcoal have no impact on indoor air quality.
It is true that carbon monoxide (CO) reduces the oxygen-carrying capacity of blood.
It is false that the Taj Mahal has remained unaffected by air pollution.
It is true that air pollution can cause eye irritation and skin allergies.
It is false that wildfires do not contribute to air pollution.
It is true that dust storms carry fine particles that reduce air quality.
It is false that only rural areas experience air pollution.
It is true that pollen from plants can contribute to air pollution.
It is false that only human efforts are needed to reduce air pollution.
It is true that renewable energy sources like wind and solar power help reduce pollution.
It is false that air pollution has no link to climate change.
It is true that global warming is caused by an increase in greenhouse gases like CO₂.
It is false that air pollution does not affect historical monuments.
It is true that air quality standards set safe limits for pollutants.
It is false that the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) has no role in monitoring air quality in India.
It is true that public transport and carpooling help reduce air pollution.
It is false that sulfur dioxide has no effect on human health.
It is true that particulate matter (PM2.5, PM10) can cause lung diseases.
